text: Darwin College is one of the colleges of the University of Cambridge, England. It was built in 1964, and it was the first college to have both men and women as students. The college has about 650 students: they are all postgraduate since Darwin does not allow undergraduates. The name comes from the famous scientist Charles Darwin and his family. Some very famous people have studied here, like Elizabeth Blackburn. She won the 2009 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in medicine. It is on the bank of River Cam opposite to Queens' College. == Other websites == *Official website Category:Colleges of the University of Cambridge Category:1964 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1960s establishments in England
title: Darwin College, Cambridge
